translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Triad in Direct and Reverse Order

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽15.60. Pītisahagataduka, Kusalattika🔽Pītisahagataṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca napītisahagato nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya          pīti sahagatam kusalam dhammam paṭicca na pīti sahagataḥ na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: The Triad with Joy🔽With a wholesome, joyful phenomenon as condition there is a non-joyful, unwholesome phenomenon … (as in §1, but with the last two terms reversed.)🔽With an unwholesome, joyful phenomenon as condition there is a non-joyful, unwholesome phenomenon … (as in §1, but with the last two terms reversed.)

original: Pītisahagataṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca napītisahagato naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Abyākatamūlaṁ tīṇiyeva paccayavasena.)
analyzed: pīti sahagatam akusalam dhammam paṭicca na pīti sahagataḥ na akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi abyākata mūlam tīṇi eva paccaya vasena
translated: (The unwholesome root has only three triplets, according to condition.)
